title: Smart Monzo Transaction Tags (iOS Shortcuts & IFTTT)
blurb: Automate your Monzo spending! This project uses IFTTT and iOS Shortcuts to prompt you to categorise transactions the moment you make them via an easy interface, adding smart, searchable tags for effortless shared expense tracking and personal categorisation.

title: Surgical Tool Segmentation
blurb: This project details a U-Net model with an EfficientNetB4 encoder for the semantic segmentation of surgical instruments. Trained on the SAR-RARP50 dataset, the model is designed to identify tools, needles, and threads from robotic-assisted surgery videos. The final solution, built in TensorFlow, achieves a Mean IoU of 0.7439 on the test set.

title: Tube Departure Board for Raspberry Pi
blurb: Recreate the iconic London Underground departure board with a Raspberry Pi! This Python-based application fetches live train data from the Transport for London (TfL) Unified API and displays it in real-time on a compact OLED screen, designed to mimic the classic dot-matrix look.

title: Hugging Face Cheat Sheet
blurb: This notebook provides a repository of hands-on code for using the Hugging Face Transformers library. It provides clear, self-contained examples for everything from data loading and pre-training to advanced applications like LoRA fine-tuning, reward modeling, and building Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems.

title: Keras Cheat Sheet
blurb: This notebook is a hands-on toolkit for Keras, covering the complete workflow for building neural networks, from data preparation to model evaluation. It provides clear examples for using both the Sequential and Functional APIs to build a range of architectures, including basic neural networks to advanced CNNs for image classification and RNNs for time series forecasting.

title: LLM with LangChain Cheat Sheet
blurb: This notebook covers the core components for building powerful applications with the LangChain framework. It begins with the essential building blocks - Models, Prompt Templates, and Chains — and shows how to combine them to build advanced systems like Retrievers, tool-using Agents and conversational Memory.

title: PyTorch Cheat Sheet
blurb: This notebook covers fundamental PyTorch concepts and provides code examples for tensor manipulation, dataset handling, building various neural network architectures, and implementing training and testing workflows. Key topics include tensor operations, custom datasets and transforms, common layers, model creation, loss functions, and optimisers.

title: NLP with PyTorch Cheat Sheet
blurb: This practical guide covers fundamental NLP techniques in PyTorch, demonstrating essential building blocks like text pre-processing, tokenization, and numerical representation. It provides clear examples for building classic models like RNNs and LSTMs from scratch for sentiment analysis and text generation.

title: Crack Detection
blurb: An automated system was developed to identify structural cracks using a deep learning approach. The methodology uses a pre-trained ResNet model, which is fine-tuned using transfer learning in PyTorch and enhanced with image augmentation.

title: QA Bot to Answer Questions from Loaded Documents
blurb: This Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbot transforms PDFs into searchable knowledge bases. Built with LangChain and IBM's watsonx.ai, it uses vector embeddings to retrieve relevant facts and a Large Language Model to generate clear, conversational answers.

title: Titanic Survival Prediction
blurb: This analysis constructs binary classification models to predict passenger survival on the Titanic, using Python and libraries like scikit-learn and pandas. It involves data cleaning and feature engineering, and compares the performance of Logistic Regression, Random Forest, and XGBoost models.

title: Waste Classification
blurb: Leveraging a pre-trained VGG16 model with transfer learning, this automated system accurately classifies waste as 'Organic' or 'Recyclable'. The solution is built in Python using TensorFlow and Keras, with its performance boosted by image augmentation and fine-tuning.
